page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Kislingbury}was first called{ {Chilesengbur}in the last Doomsday book it was called{Ciselingberie. { }During the Civil War,General Fairfax and his roundhead army camped in Kislingbury.the later began their pusuit of{King Charles.} on June 12 1645{Oliver Cromwell} stopped in the big house on the corner of the high street,now called the{ {Cromwell Cottage.} The Parish Church Of St.Lukes was first built in 1219 and the first ever rector was called David De Amenters.in 1332 there was a rector called{Jon {De Kislingbury}and this is where the present name comes from. In 1887 the church clock was erected in honour of Queen Victoria.In 1914 the war broke out and some of the villagers had to fight.Many died and a Memorial Cross was erected in honour.
